user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketShutdown:
```c
int32 OS_SocketShutdown(osal_id_t sock_id, OS_SocketShutdownMode_t Mode)
{
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;
    OS_object_token_t            token;
    int32                        return_code;

    /* Confirm that "Mode" is one of the 3 acceptable values */
    BUGCHECK(Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ || Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE ||
                 Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READWRITE,
             OS_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sock_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, token);

        if (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID)
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE;
        }
        else if (stream->socket_type == OS_SocketType_STREAM && (stream->stream_state & OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED) == 0)
        {
            /* Stream socket must not be connected */
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SocketShutdown_Impl(&token, Mode);

            if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
            {
                if (Mode & OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ)
                {
                    stream->stream_state &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_READABLE;
                }
                if (Mode & OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE)
                {
                    stream->stream_state &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_WRITABLE;
                }
            }
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SocketShutdown:
#define BUGCHECK(cond, errcode) if(!(cond)){BUGREPORT("\n**BUG** %s():%d:check \'%s\' FAILED --> %s\n\n",__func__,__LINE__,#cond,#errcode);returnerrcode;}
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef enum
{
    OS_SocketShutdownMode_NONE           = 0, /**< @brief Reserved value, no effect */
    OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ      = 1, /**< @brief Disable future reading */
    OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE     = 2, /**< @brief Disable future writing */
    OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READWRITE = 3  /**< @brief Disable future reading or writing */
} OS_SocketShutdownMode_t
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_stream_internal_record_t OS_stream_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct
{
    char   stream_name[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];
    uint8  socket_domain;
    uint8  socket_type;
    uint16 stream_state;
} OS_stream_internal_record_t
...
int32 OS_SocketShutdown_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_SocketShutdownMode_t Mode)
{
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *conn_impl;
    int32                           return_code;
    int                             how;

    conn_impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    /* Note that when called via the shared layer,
     * the "Mode" arg has already been checked/validated. */
    if (Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ)
    {
        how = SHUT_RD;
    }
    else if (Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE)
    {
        how = SHUT_WR;
    }
    else
    {
        how = SHUT_RDWR;
    }

    if (shutdown(conn_impl->fd, how) == 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
    }
    else
    {
        return_code = OS_ERROR;
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish(token, NULL);
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-42)
...
#define OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE (-36)
...
#define OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE (-35)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I reviewed the provided target function and the related functions/macros for any modification of function parameters (including pointer parameters themselves). No assignments or mutations to the parameter variables themselves were found: 

- OS_SocketShutdown(osal_id_t sock_id, OS_SocketShutdownMode_t Mode): Neither sock_id nor Mode is assigned to or modified anywhere in the function. Mode is only read (checked via BUGCHECK, passed by value to OS_SocketShutdown_Impl, and used in bit tests). Passing &token uses the address of a local variable, not a parameter.

- OS_SocketShutdown_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_SocketShutdownMode_t Mode): The token parameter is declared as a pointer to const, preventing modification of the pointed-to object in this function; Mode is only read and not assigned to. No assignment to the pointer parameter or to Mode occurs.

- OS_ObjectIdGetById(..., OS_object_token_t *token): The function writes to fields of *token (token->obj_idx, token->obj_id) which is allowed by Rule 17.8 (the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified). There is no assignment to the pointer variable token itself (no token = ...), so the pointer parameter is not modified.

- OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token) and other helper calls: They pass token to other routines but do not reassign the token parameter within these definitions shown.

- Macros: BUGCHECK and OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET were inspected. BUGCHECK only tests/returns; it does not assign to function parameters. OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET takes an expression and computes an address/index but does not perform assignments to the function parameter variables.

Given the above, there are no code fragments in the provided code that appear to modify function parameters themselves (which would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8). The only pointer-parameter modifications are to pointee fields (e.g., token->obj_idx), which is permitted by the rule.
